alert.note: Alert for San Juan (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 26 at 4:34PM MDT until July 26 at 6:15PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 745 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Arroyo and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Utah, including the following county, San Juan. * WHEN...Until 745 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Rises in small streams and normally dry arroyos. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 432 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms along Needles Overlook Road, leading into Canyonlands National Park. This will cause arroyo and small stream flooding. Between 0.7 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... mainly rural areas of North Central San Juan County, including areas along Needles Overlook Road heading into Canyonlands National Park.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
